title: Let’s Agree to Disagree: Fixing Agreement Measures for Crowdsourcing
segmentation: For that we published together with some colleagues Alessandro at the John Luca Stefano that sat over there.

And so in our setting we are dealing with microtask crowdsourcing, where multiple workers do the same task and we compute and we want to leverage agreement among workers, and we think that agreement should be leveraged to estimate the reliability of the collected data and also to understand the behavior of the workers.
So a bit of agreement formalisation, so we have.

The thing that we identified is that the current agreement measures are in and wait, so are often borrowed from other scenarios that have some assumption.

There are not always true for crowdsourcing, and often they deal with data reliability and not data agreement, which is something slightly different you I share with you later on the slide, so you have all the details if you want to dig deeper.
So there are many problems, for example.
If you have a finite scale and you have judgments on a scale, then you have like by nature you have some variability.
More variability of the judgment in the center of a scale.
So in the blue distribution rather than in the border of the scale.
So if the agreement measure does not account for that, then you can overestimate agreement close to scale boundaries just because of the finite scale that you're dealing with.
Or if you have multiple items and your concentration points so your agreement or your ground truth is different for every item, then not all the agreement measures deal with that.
So this can lead to overestimate or underestimate agreement.
Other words in so you can have gold questions, so you ask for something that you already know the answer.
Just to let us know if the worker is able to do that, and there are often metrics that there does not consider that.
So basically you're throwing out data so you are not processing all the data that you have.

And every matrix, every agreement matrix that is available as a notion of agreement by chance, which is the agreement that naturally occurs when you're writing something and they perform correction by chance.

So random guessing can have high agreement or random guessing can even be more agreement that honest coding.
